intro: Lorostemon colombianus, commonly known as the Colombian lorostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Lorostemon colombianus is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
